title: Get warning when adding StrictMode with redux application
body:
I'm upgrading the `react` from `16.2.0` to `16.4.0` and I added the component `StrictMode` to the root component : 
```
const App = props => (

  <MuiThemeProvider theme={theme}>
    <I18nextProvider i18n={i18n}>
      <Provider store={store}>
        <BrowserRouter>
          <React.StrictMode>
            <AppRoutes kcRole={props.kcRole} />
          </React.StrictMode>
        </BrowserRouter>
      </Provider>
    </I18nextProvider>
  </MuiThemeProvider>

);

ReactDOM.render(
      <App />,
      document.getElementById('App'),
    );
```
I got these warnings:
```
Unsafe lifecycle methods were found within a strict-mode tree:
    in Router (created by BrowserRouter)
    in BrowserRouter (created by App)
    in Provider (created by App)
    in I18nextProvider (created by App)
    in MuiThemeProvider (created by App)
    in App

componentWillMount: Please update the following components to use componentDidMount instead: I18n, Route, Switch

componentWillReceiveProps: Please update the following components to use static getDerivedStateFromProps instead: Connect(WithStyles(Translate(MainDrawer))), Connect(WithStyles(Translate(snackbar))), Route, Switch

componentWillUpdate: Please update the following components to use componentDidUpdate instead: Connect(WithStyles(Translate(MainDrawer))), Connect(WithStyles(Translate(snackbar)))

Learn more about this warning here:
https://fb.me/react-strict-mode-warnings

```
Should I put `StrictMode` with each component of the app separately to avoid the warning due to different packages such as `redux`?

**OS:** ubuntu 17.10 (64bit)
**Browser:** chromium  v66.0.3359.181
**react:** 16.4.0
**react-dom:** 16.4.0
**redux:** 3.7.2
